title: Trump administration’s use of AI images pushes boundaries and further eroded public trust, experts say
description: The White House’s use of artificial intelligence has troubled misinformation experts who fear the spreading of AI-generated or edited images erodes public perception of the truth and sows distrust.
content:
LOS ANGELES — The Trump administration has not shied away from sharing AI-generated imagery online, embracing cartoonlike visuals and memes and promoting them on official White House channels.
But an edited — and realistic — image of civil rights att... [6502 chars]

title: Taiwan, US discuss tech, AI and drone cooperation at high-level forum
description: Senior Taiwanese and U.S. officials discussed cooperation in artificial intelligence, tech and drones at a high-level forum begun during the first Trump administration, with the U.S. State Department praising Taipei as a "vital partner."

title: Government funding for AI jobs did not produce more jobs, research finds
description: Artificial intelligence is reshaping how companies operate, but it may not translate into more job creation, according to new research.
content:
Artificial intelligence is reshaping how companies operate, but it may not translate into more job creation, according to new research.

title: Pope Leo makes bizarre plea for young men to stop talking to overly affectionate fake online girlfriends
description: Pope Leo XIV pleaded with Catholics to prevent artificial intelligence to replace human relationships in his message.
content:
Pope Leo XIV has issued a stark warning about 'overly affectionate' chatbots that he says are destroying human relationships.

title: SoftBank Is in Talks to Invest $30 Billion More in OpenAI
description: SoftBank Group Corp. is in discussions to invest as much as $30 billion more in OpenAI, a sharp increase in commitment that reflects founder Masayoshi Son’s ambitions to play a central role in developing artificial intelligence.
content:

title: Over 100 Indian AI startup founders moving to US for funds and talent
description: More than 100 Indian AI founders have moved or are preparing to move to the US, drawn by closer access to customers, capital and the most advanced artificial intelligence ecosystems, despite talk of a reverse brain drain. Composio, Meetstream.ai, Smallest.ai, Beatoven.ai and GetCrux are among startups that have moved base to the US over the past couple of years, while several others are in the process of relocating, investors and founders told ET.
content:

title: Pilot to platform: how enterprises turn AI experiments into results
description: Australia’s long experimentation phase with artificial intelligence is giving way to a more sober and consequential challenge.
content: For many organisations, the early attraction of AI lay in its novelty. Teams were encouraged to run pilots, test generative models on isolated datasets or explore new interfaces for internal search. These experiments helped build familiarity, but the... [5959 chars]

content:
